DOCNAME: CASE OF GUIDI AND OTHERS v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are the owners of a flat in PERSON , which they had let to A.M.
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on DATE , the applicants communicated their intention to terminate the lease and summoned the tenant to appear before the Sorrento Magistrate .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , the ORG refused to uphold the validity of the notice to quit , declined jurisdiction on account of the value of the case and indicated that ORG had jurisdiction to hear it .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants resumed the proceedings before ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , which was filed with the registry on DATE , the court allowed the applicants ' claim and ordered that the premises be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the tenant appealed to ORG of appeal .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , which was filed with the registry on CARDINAL DATE , the court rejected the appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants served notice on the tenant requiring him to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , they served notice on the tenant informing him that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .

CARDINAL . As from DATE until DATE , the bailiff made several attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as , under the statutory provisions providing for the staggering of evictions , the applicants were not entitled to police assistance in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the tenant vacated the premises .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is described in the ORG 's judgment in the case of ORG GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-V.
